author: VNExplorer
title: Aldi will open in March in 2024 with up to 50 new jobs
text:
Up to 50 jobs are set to be created next year when supermarket giant Aldi finally opens its new store in March.
The budget supermarket brand has confirmed it will be opening a planned new store on the town’s Hostmoor Avenue as part of a £6million investment by the firm across Cambridgeshire.
Fenland planners gave permission for the supermarket to be built at a meeting in July when councillors decided “shoppers would vote with their feet” once the store is up and running to determine whether or not it is wanted.
Fenland’s planning committee approved plans for the March Aldi in July 2023.
The value-chain pledged to either provide its own traffic management scheme to improve safety at the junction of Hostmoor Avenue and the A141 or provide a cash contribution towards the March Area Transport Strategy to provide a scheme as part of its planning application commitment.
The store is to be built on a 0.9 hectare brown acre site that stands on the corner of Hostmoor Avenue and Martin Avenue and is described by Aldi as ‘medium-sized’.
There will be 102 parking spaces on site and the store itself will have 1,804 sqm of internal space.
Aldi plans to open its new March store in 2024 with the creation of up to 50 jobs.
Aldi has previously said it has “long wanted” to open a store in March and that the March Trading Park was the ideal location.
However, the plans did not go down well with everyone with rivals Tesco, located opposite the proposed store’s site, among those to object.
Aldi has long wanted to open a store in March.
The opening will follow planned upgrades to other Cambridgeshire stores and is part of a £1.4 billion investment being made by Aldi across the country thanks to numerous planned store openings in 2024.

author: Crisis24
title: Officials issue flash flood warning for parts of northeastern Puerto Rico until at least 13:30 AST Nov....
text: 01 Nov 2024 | 02:53 PM UTC Puerto Rico: Flash flood warning in effect for northeastern parts of the island until at least 13:30 AST Nov. 1 Officials issue flash flood warning for parts of northeastern Puerto Rico until at least 13:30 AST Nov. 1. Disruptions possible. The US National Weather Service (NWS) has issued a flash flood warning for much of Ceiba, Fajardo, Luquillo, Naguabo, and Rio Grande municipalities in northeastern Puerto Rico until at least 13:30 AST Nov. 1. Officials could amend the warning for the impacted areas and/or extend it to the surrounding regions on short notice. Sustained heavy rainfall could trigger flooding in low-lying communities near rivers, streams, and creeks. Urban flooding is also possible in developed areas with easily overwhelmed stormwater drainage systems. Sites located downstream from large reservoirs or rivers may be subject to flash flooding after relatively short periods of intense rainfall. Landslides are possible in hilly areas, especially where heavy rain has saturated the soil. Localized business disruptions may occur in low-lying areas; some businesses might not operate at full capacity because of flood damage to facilities, possible evacuations, and some employees' inability to reach work sites. Transport, electricity, and telecommunications disruptions are also possible in areas impacted by flooding. Monitor local media for weather updates and related advisories. Confirm all transport reservations and business appointments before travel. Make allowances for localized travel delays and potential supply chain disruptions where flooding has been forecast. Do not drive on flooded roads. Charge battery-powered devices in the case of prolonged electricity outages.

author: ANASTASIA NICHOLAS
title: Fairmount, Great Lakes Science Center offer new programming at Chardon location | Local Government | chagrinvalleytoday.com
text:
The Fairmount Center for the Arts and Great Lakes Science Center will offer new Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Math (STEAM) programming designed for homeschool families this fall at Fairmount’s Chardon Square location.
“This STEAM initiative invites young learners to explore the world through experimentation, innovation and creative expression – fostering curiosity, critical thinking and collaboration in a dynamic, supportive environment,” according to a press release. “Each project-based class will be taught by Science Center educators and Fairmount teaching artists.”

author: tengrinews.kz
title: Sharp cold snap is expected in Kazakhstan
text: [Tengrinews.kz](https://en.tengrinews.kz/) - Meteorologists have issued a forecast for the weather in Kazakhstan on November 2, 3, and 4. [Tengrinews.kz](https://en.tengrinews.kz/) - Meteorologists have issued a forecast for the weather in Kazakhstan on November 2, 3, and 4. Under the influence of atmospheric fronts, unstable weather is expected across most of Kazakhstan over the next three days, with rain and snow in many areas. However, on November 2-3 in the southeast and November 3-4 in the east, the weather will be dry. Fog is expected in the west, northwest, and southern regions, while strong winds and ice are expected in the north and central parts of the country. "By the end of this period, a sharp drop in nighttime temperatures to 0-7 degrees Celsius below zero and daytime temperatures to -2 to +5 degrees Celsius is expected in the west, northwest, and north. In the center and east, nighttime temperatures will rise to 0-8 degrees Celsius above zero, with daytime temperatures reaching 8-13 degrees Celsius. In the south and southeast, nighttime temperatures will range from 3-13 degrees Celsius, with daytime highs from 15-22 degrees Celsius," the report states. Earlier, meteorologists provided an outlook for the[ 2024/2025 winter in Kazakhstan](https://en.tengrinews.kz/environment/what-will-winter-2024-2025-be-like-in-kazakhstan-264538/). November is expected to have alternating warm and cold days, with snow in most parts of the country and rain with snow possible in the south and southwest. Strong winds, possible blizzards, and icy conditions are also anticipated.

author: CA WILDFIRE BOT
title: Wildfire breaks out in Merced County, CA | Fresno Bee
text:
Fires
Breaking: New wildfire reported in Merced County on May 7
The creation of this content included the use of AI based on templates created, reviewed and edited by journalists in the newsroom. Read more on our AI policy here.
First discovered: 6:35 p.m. May 7
Initial location: Merced County, Calif.
Fire type: Wildfire
Fire name: Hwy 99 Cross / Collier Rd
A new wildfire was reported today at 6:35 p.m. in Merced County.
The wildfire has been burning on private land. There is currently no information on the containment of the fire and its cause has not yet been determined.
Source: National Interagency Fire Center
This story was originally published May 7, 2025 at 7:04 PM.
